alert.note: Alert for Giles (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 2:42AM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Richland Creek Above Pulaski affecting Giles County. For the Richland Creek...including Pulaski...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Richland Creek Above Pulaski. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Portions of Vales Mill Rd between Chicken Creek Rd and the Highway 64 bypass become inundated and may be subject to closure * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 16.7 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.9 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CST.
